description: Number of ways to express 2n+1 as p+2a^2; p = 1 or prime, a >= 0.
comments: Goldbach conjectured this sequence is never zero.The only zero terms appear to be for the odd numbers 5777 and 5993. - T. D. Noe, Aug 23 2008a(n) = A046920(A005408(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 03 2013
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..10000
L. Hodges, A lesser-known Goldbach conjecture, Math. Mag., 66 (1993), 45-47.
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
author: _David W. Wilson_
